title: First Student Training
subtitle: Building a New Generation
description: First student camp for the inaugural cohort of Saleh Kamel Applied Technology School.
content:
Launch Camp: Building a New Generation at Saleh Kamel Applied Technology School

As part of LK Hub‚Äôs vision to advance technical education and elevate young talents‚Äô skills, the first student camp for the inaugural cohort of Saleh Kamel Applied Technology School for Ready-Made Garments and Textiles was launched in Tanta, Gharbia Governorate, for the 2024‚Äì2025 academic year.

Goals Beyond Traditional Education
The camp was not just an academic start, but a comprehensive educational experience aimed at strengthening students‚Äô sense of belonging and developing their personal and leadership skills. Activities focused on positive interaction, emotional intelligence, creative problem-solving, and raising awareness of personal safety and protection policies.

Character Building & Life Skills
A group of experts and specialists participated, including:

Emotional Intelligence & Self-Awareness: Dr. Sherine delivered interactive sessions on emotional intelligence, helping students assess themselves and identify strengths.

First Aid: In cooperation with the Red Crescent, students received intensive practical training in emergency response and lifesaving skills.

Creative Thinking & Communication: Dr. Mohamed Hamed, capacity-building consultant, conducted workshops on creative thinking and presentation skills.

Academic & Technical Preparation
Students attended preparatory sessions including:

Introduction to technical competencies and specialized garment and textile knowledge.

Orientation to Arabic and German language curricula and cultural/scientific subjects such as mathematics and chemistry.

Practical fashion design workshops.

Inspirational Visits & Institutional Support
Dr. Lobna Khairy, CEO of LK Hub, followed up on activities. Dr. Zahra El-Sherbiny, fashion business consultant, also met students.

Team Spirit & Official Launch
Sports and group activities strengthened bonds. The camp concluded successfully, marking the official start of studies.

title: First Teachers Training
subtitle: Professional Development
description: Qualification camp for academic & administrative staff to prepare for the 24/25 academic year.
content:
First Qualification Camp for Academic & Administrative Staff

Held 15‚Äì17 October 2024 to prepare for the 2024‚Äì2025 academic year. Focused on school vision, psychological and educational support, and operational readiness.

title: Gharbia Governor visit
subtitle: Official Visit
description: Major General Ashraf El-Gendy visited the school, praising its advanced facilities.
content:
Visit of Gharbia Governor to the School

Major General Ashraf El-Gendy, Governor of Gharbia, and Mr. Nasser Hassan visited the school, praising it as the first of its kind nationwide in ready-made garments specialization.

title: Field training begins
subtitle: Hands-on Experience
description: Students began field training at Family Factory in El-Mahalla with strict safety procedures.
content:
Launch of Field Training for Students

Students began field training at Family Factory in El-Mahalla, with safe transportation and strict safety procedures.

title: Teacher Training at Saleh Kamel School
subtitle: Competency Methodology
description: Five-day training on professional competency methodology led by education experts.
content:
Teacher Training at Saleh Kamel School

Five-day training on professional competency methodology led by Dr. Mohamed Osama and Dr. Gaber Galal under supervision of Dr. Mohamed Abdelmaksoud.

title: Evacuation Training
subtitle: Safety First
description: Practical emergency evacuation drills to ensure student safety.
content:
Evacuation Plan Drills

Practical emergency evacuation drills to ensure student safety.

title: Entrepreneurship - A curriculum designed for specialization
subtitle: Innovation Curriculum
description: Specialized entrepreneurship curriculum designed to prepare students for the labor market.
content:
Entrepreneurship Curriculum for Garments & Textiles

A specialized entrepreneurship curriculum designed with leading experts to prepare students for the labor market.

title: A visit to the Faculty of Applied Arts Tanta University
subtitle: Academic Tour
description: Students toured the Ready-Made Garments Department and attended technical lectures.
content:
Students‚Äô Visit to Faculty of Applied Arts ‚Äì Tanta University

Students toured the Ready-Made Garments Department and attended lectures:

‚ÄúSmart Clothing and Innovations in Garment Industry‚Äù by Dr. Seham Dawoud

‚ÄúPattern Magic‚Äù by Dr. Maha Ibrahim Araf
Included practical pattern drawing and draping on mannequins.

subtitle: Cultural Excursion
description: Visits to the Pyramids, Salah El-Din Citadel, and Safari Park.
content:

Visits to the Pyramids, Salah El-Din Citadel, and Safari Park.

title: Participation in EDUTech Exhibition
subtitle: Exhibition
description: Students visited the LK-Hub pavilion and met with industry leaders.
content:
Participation in EDUTech Exhibition

Students visited LK-Hub pavilion. Met Dr. Amr Basila and Dr. Rasha Fathy. Federation of Egyptian Industries also hosted them.

title: Accreditation of Salah Kamel School of Applied Technology by the German-Arab Chamber
subtitle: International Recognition
description: Students receive official German accreditation from year one via new protocol.
content:
German Arab Chamber Accreditation

LK-Hub signed accreditation protocol with the German Arab Chamber of Industry and Commerce. Students receive official German accreditation from year one.

title: Salah Kamel Visit
subtitle: Foundation Visit
description: Executive delegation visited workshops and viewed student projects.
content:
Visit of Saleh Kamel Humanitarian Foundation

Executive delegation visited workshops and classrooms, viewed student projects. Presentation covered achievements since early September last year.

title: Participation in Ministry of Culture Event ‚ÄúMahfouz in the Heart‚Äù
subtitle: Cultural Event
description: Students presented creative works reflecting Egyptian identity.
content:
Participation in Ministry of Culture Event ‚ÄúMahfouz in the Heart‚Äù

First applied technology school to participate. Students presented creative works reflecting Egyptian identity.

title: Workshops opening

content:
Opening of Training Workshops ‚Äì March 2025

Workshops officially operational with modern machinery.

Participation in ‚ÄúElham‚Äù Campaign

title: Entrepreneurship Camp
subtitle: Summer Camp
description: Covered strategic planning, management, and branding with market visits and pitching.
content:
Entrepreneurship Camp ‚Äì Starting 15 June (Two Weeks)

Covered strategic planning, financial/logistical management, branding, market visits, pitching, digital awareness, sports activities. Hosted Mr. Omar Khalifa (Shaghalni Center).

title: Dethar Competition ‚Äì 2024‚Äì2025
subtitle: Student Competition
description: End-of-year event where 8 groups presented projects to industry jury.
content:
‚ÄúDethar‚Äù Competition ‚Äì 2024‚Äì2025

Final event of first academic year. 8 groups presented projects. Jury included Dr. Zahra El-Sherbiny and industry founders. Winning teams listed (1st‚Äì4th places).

description: Student-designed competition narrated by Dr. Lobna Khairy.
content:
Dethar I Season One ‚Äì Summer 2025

content:
